version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.name: fast-forward button

bn:13698982v: To cause media to roll fast.
To cause an audio or video tape, digital media stream, etc. to move forward very fast, so that when the device is played, it will start at a later point.

bn:00005896n: A mark to indicate a direction or relation
A mark to indicate a direction or relation.
A sign or symbol used to indicate a direction (e.g. \to).

bn:00866684n: Fast Forward is an Australian comedy show that ran from April 12, 1989 and ended on November 26, 1992. Forward
To fast-forward is to move forward through a recording at a speed faster than that at which it would usually be played.
The forward movement through an audio or video recording faster than the speed at which it was originally recorded
